items.title: What's next, as Liberals and Nationals go their own way?
items.description: In the wake of the Coalition's divorce, there are few options for besieged Opposition Leader Sussan Ley, who must again reshuffle her cabinet and return to parliament with a diminished Opposition.

items.title: The optics are diabolical for Liberals and Nationals, as chaos reigns
items.description: Littleproud and his team have now basically broken one of the most fundamental political rules of the Coalition — the Nationals are now effectively dictating to the Liberals who their leader should be.

items.title: 'Screams vulnerability': The visa that leaves migrant workers exposed to potential slavery
items.description: Australia's anti-slavery commissioner has written to Home Affairs Minister Tony Burke asking for reform on the 407 training visa, following the inquest into the death of Jerwin Royupa.

items.title: In Davos, European leaders met Trump with strength and he backed down
items.description: European leaders will be breathing a sigh of relief that the extraordinary threat of a US invasion of Greenland has receded. But some things cannot be undone.

items.title: Breaking: Multiple fatalities reported in shooting in Central West NSW town
items.description: A police operation is underway in the Central West town of Lake Cargelligo amid reports that multiple people have been shot dead.

items.title: Sombre scenes as Australians mark day of mourning for Bondi attack victims
items.description: Australians throughout the country have paused to reflect on the Bondi Beach terror attack.

items.title: A look at the 'Golden Dome' and why Trump wants one in Greenland
items.description: Donald Trump wants a US "Golden Dome" missile defence system to be built in Greenland. This is what it involves and why some experts are skeptical of the plan.

items.title: PhD candidate working at CSIRO accused of planning Australia Day terror attack
items.description: Sepehr Saryazdi has been accused of planning to use Molotov cocktails and lead a "riot" at the Gold Coast on Australia Day.

items.title: Live: Young girl among several missing after landslide at a NZ campsite
items.description: Several people are missing after a landslide at a campsite in the tourism hotspot of Mount Maunganui, south-east of Auckland.

items.title: Cars plucked from ocean in astonishing flood recovery mission
items.description: Emergency services have conducted a dramatic salvage operation to recover more than a dozen vehicles from shoreline along Victoria's famous Great Ocean Road.

items.title: Woman found dead at K'gari a 'free spirit that couldn't be contained'
items.description: Friends of 19-year-old Canadian woman Piper James pay tribute to a woman who loved adventure and nature.

items.title: March for Australia admins encouraged people to join White Australia Party
items.description: March for Australia organisers are planning a fresh round of mass demonstrations across the country on January 26, with members encouraging others to join the now disbanded White Australia Party.

items.title: Australian retiree's detention in Thailand a warning, lawyer says
items.description: Rights groups slam Thai authorities' detention and legal proceedings against Australian writer Murray Hunter, after Malaysia's communications regulator submitted a criminal defamation complaint.

items.title: Live: Qualifier keeps Australian women's tilt alive with thrilling second-round win
items.description: Qualifier Maddison Inglis reaches the third round with a tense victory over German veteran Laura Siegemund to remain the last local alive in the women's singles draw. Later, Nick Kyrgios and Thanasi Kokkinakis kick off their doubles campaign. Follow live.

items.title: Brisbane girls' school principal resigns following leaking scandal
items.description: A prestigious Brisbane girls' school principal will resign, following a scandal where personal student information was leaked to the public.

items.title: Temperature records tipped to break when heatwave hits Victoria
items.description: The Bureau of Meteorology says maximum temperature records could tumble in some areas early next week — with the town of Ouyen tipped to reach 48 degrees — with heatwave conditions set to send temperatures soaring.

items.title: If your kid's asking for brands, your response could make a huge difference
items.description: Managing back-to-school costs, especially when kids want expensive brand name items, can cause a lot of stress for families. But including children in the budgeting and decision-making process is key to helping everyone get on the same page.

items.title: Debt is America's Achilles heel in a fracturing world order
items.description: For decades, global investors have bought US government debt as a safe haven when things turn pear-shaped. But investor attitudes are changing, and America's financial domination is at stake.

items.title: Financial advisor jailed for taking more than $1m from clients
items.description: Victims of a Perth financial adviser jailed for misappropriating more than a million dollars from investors say his six-year jail term is not enough.

items.title: Woman admits to threatening to kill former psychiatrist
items.description: A judge tells a Victorian court the safety of healthcare workers must be protected while remanding a mentally ill woman to jail.

items.title: Guide dog handler left a 'bit stunned' by drive-by confrontation
items.description: Adelaide woman Nicole Willing, who has a vision impairment, said she was recently walking in Belair with guide dog Jetta when a driver stopped and "blurted out a mouthful", claiming it was too hot for her to be walking her dog.

items.title: Former police officer acquitted of abandoning children in US school shooting
items.description: A former officer charged with child abandonment and endangerment over the police response to the Uvalde school massacre in 2022 is acquitted.

items.title: Critically endangered sawfish found mutilated on beach
items.description: Residents and experts say they are shocked and concerned after social media images showed a number of endangered and protected marine animals impaled and severed on a stretch of WA coastline in just a few weeks.

items.title: Vietnamese gen Zs reclaim forebears' exploitative history of garment outwork
items.description: Jennifer Kiều Anh Doan's boutique's focus on independent Vietnamese fashioners is subverting her forebears' experience as exploited garment "outworkers".

items.title: Family of Manly shark attack survivor calls for 'positive energy'
items.description: Andre de Ruyter is described by his family as a talented musician who loves surfing.
